                    });                 });             }          } })();  BALTIMORE \xe2\x80\x94 In the middle of the seventh inning of the Baltimore Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 game against the Arizona Diamondbacks two Friday nights ago, the public-address announcer asked the crowd at Camden Yards to stand and celebrate America\xe2\x80\x99s diversity. Three singers then stood on the first-base dugout and did a rendition of \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land,\xe2\x80\x9d the famous folk song written by Woody Guthrie.By the time the end of the third verse arrived \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cAll around me a voice was sounding, this land was made for you and me\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 fans had joined in.In a tradition that dates to the aftermath of the Sept. 11 terror attacks in 2001, \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America\xe2\x80\x9d is played in major league ballparks around the country, including in Baltimore, during the seventh-inning stretch of Sunday games. The song can also be heard during assorted holiday games, and the Yankees play the song during the seventh inning of every home game.But Baltimore is the only major league franchise to regularly play \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land,\xe2\x80\x9d which it does at Friday home games. And the song, long considered an anthem of the left because of its populist themes, is meant to be more than a Camden Yards singalong. It is a subtle, yet intentional, message from the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 management that at the intersection of sports and patriotism, one size does not have to fit all. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      \xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\x98God Bless America\xe2\x80\x99 speaks to a lot of people,\xe2\x80\x9d said John Angelos, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 chief operating officer and the son of the team\xe2\x80\x99s owner, Peter Angelos. But, he added, \xe2\x80\x9cthere is a strain of progressivism in American life, and if we can reflect it, I think that\xe2\x80\x99s a good thing.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles began occasionally playing Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s song in the 2015 season. This year, they made it a staple on Fridays, which means it was in place before San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick focused attention on a nationwide debate when he declined to stand for the national anthem before an N.F.L. exhibition game in August.Kaepernick cited racial oppression as the reason for his action, which paved the way for symbolic gestures by other athletes, some who have knelt during the anthem, others who have linked arms while standing at attention and still others who have raised a clenched fist.Set against all this is Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s song, which the Orioles, who finish the season at Yankee Stadium, will have a chance to play again this year only if the team makes it to the playoffs. Regardless, they plan to keep playing \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land\xe2\x80\x9d next season. In the meantime, Angelos is keeping a close eye on all the ripple effects created by Kaepernick. Photo       Woody Guthrie, above, who was known for his songs about the downtrodden, wrote \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land\xe2\x80\x9d in 1940 as an answer to Irving Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America.\xe2\x80\x9d  Credit             Associated Press           \xe2\x80\x9cI hope people in the sports industry are learning from what Colin Kaepernick is doing,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI hope we can learn that speaking out about your country is not un-American, that words like \xe2\x80\x98un-American\xe2\x80\x99 have no place.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As for the criticism Kaepernick has faced, Angelos called it \xe2\x80\x9cdisgusting.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cIt reeks of McCarthyism,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The history of Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s tune is linked to \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America,\xe2\x80\x9d which was written by Irving Berlin and then recorded by Kate Smith in 1938, when it became a hit at a time of uneasiness in the years leading up to World War II.Guthrie, who had spent years traveling the country during the Great Depression, had Communist sympathies and a different, more defiant, vision of the United States than the one conveyed in \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America.\xe2\x80\x9d As an answer to that song, he wrote \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land\xe2\x80\x9d in 1940.His original lyrics questioned the merits of private property and included lines that were never officially recorded: \xe2\x80\x9cBy the relief office, I saw my people. As they stood there hungry, I stood there wondering if this land was made for you and me.\xe2\x80\x9d Through the years, the song was popularized by Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s son, Arlo, and others, including Pete Seeger and Bruce Springsteen. Privacy Policy     John Shaw, the author of \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land That I Love,\xe2\x80\x9d a book about the two songs, said the two songwriters had more in common than meets the eye. Although \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America\xe2\x80\x9d has become associated with unvarnished patriotism, that was not Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s intent. When the song was written, Shaw said, it was Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s way of showing gratitude that he was no longer in Europe. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a love letter written by an immigrant to his adopted country,\xe2\x80\x9d Shaw said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As for Guthrie, Shaw noted that while the original lyrics were a sarcastic response to Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s song, \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land\xe2\x80\x9d evolved, too. \xe2\x80\x9cIt became a love song to America, too,\xe2\x80\x9d Shaw said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  In the aftermath of the Sept. 11 attacks, major league teams began playing Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s song as a show of patriotism. But Angelos also thought about how the Orioles could diversify the way they honored America. For instance, the team now has a program to honor community heroes at Friday, Saturday and Sunday home games. Photo       John Angelos, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 chief operating officer, said, \xe2\x80\x9cThere is a strain of progressivism in American life, and if we can reflect it, I think that\xe2\x80\x99s a good thing.\xe2\x80\x9d  Credit             Todd Olszewski/Orioles           The core of the idea was to celebrate various citizens, and not just members of the military, and pair each day with a different song (\xe2\x80\x9cAmerica the Beautiful\xe2\x80\x9d is played on Saturdays). Last Friday, the community hero was a bus driver, Reneita Smith, who saved a group of elementary students from a burning school bus.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cPeople forget a lot of these stadiums are publicly funded buildings and, by law, they have to welcome people from all different walks of life,\xe2\x80\x9d Angelos said. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes sports can be narrowcast in the causes and groups focused on. Our idea is that everyone should be included; let\xe2\x80\x99s not leave anyone out.\xe2\x80\x9dThat the Orioles are taking this approach is not all that surprising. Peter Angelos made his fortune representing workers in asbestos cases. He refused to sign replacement players during the strike by players in 1994 and 1995, and he helped arrange for the Orioles to play a home-and-home series with the Cuban national team in 1999 at a time when there was no active relationship between the countries.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  During protests over the death of Freddie Gray, a black man killed while in the custody of the Baltimore police last year, John Angelos spoke publicly about needing to put the demonstrations within the context of longstanding racial inequality.\xe2\x80\x9cThis family, these owners, have always been on the side of the unions, of the people,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles center fielder Adam Jones said in reference to the Angeloses. \xe2\x80\x9cThe city means something to them.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Still, for most Orioles fans at Camden Yards, \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land\xe2\x80\x9d remains a song and not much more. Jones, who recently said that athlete protests over the national anthem had not spread to baseball because of a lack of racial diversity in the sport, said he was not conversant with the song\xe2\x80\x99s political history.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Several fans, asked about the song\xe2\x80\x99s meaning last week, also pleaded ignorance. \xe2\x80\x9cI doubt most of our guys know who Woody Guthrie is,\xe2\x80\x9d Manager Buck Showalter added.  For his part, John Angelos said it did not bother him that many fans and players may not know the song\xe2\x80\x99s origins because it was only one aspect of the community heroes program.\xe2\x80\x9cWe can honor a veteran, but we can also honor a veteran who is against a particular war,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cThat diversity is what the song represents.\xe2\x80\x9d  A version of this article appears in print on October 1, 2016, on Page D3 of the New York edition with the headline: In Baltimore, This Song Is Their Song.                     });                 });             }          } })();  Jonathan Schoop finished his interview in the Baltimore Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 clubhouse Friday night, then peeked over the heads of the reporters by his locker. The televisions in the middle of the room were showing the final inning of the Toronto Blue Jays\xe2\x80\x99 game in Boston. The Jays were down to their last out.\xe2\x80\x9cStrike him out,\xe2\x80\x9d said Schoop, who had just driven in five runs against the Yankees. But his heart was not really in it. He left the room before the Red Sox obliged, lifting the Orioles into the top spot in the American League wild-card race. The Orioles have reason to be confident; if they keep winning, they will need no help to host a game at Camden Yards next week.With a soggy 8-1 victory over the Yankees in the Bronx \xe2\x80\x94 and the Blue Jays\xe2\x80\x99 5-3 loss at Fenway Park \xe2\x80\x94 the Orioles now stand a game ahead of the Blue Jays. They nearly fell three back on Wednesday, before a ninth-inning, pinch-hit homer by Hyun Soo Kim in Toronto.\xe2\x80\x9cI thought we were going to win that game, frankly,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dan Duquette, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 executive vice president for baseball operations. \xe2\x80\x9cI really did, because we\xe2\x80\x99d played a good game. We played good defense, we got good pitching. We still had a shot. And that was a terrific at-bat by Kim.\xe2\x80\x9d Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      Now the Orioles have won six of their last seven. At 88-72, they can clinch one of the wild-card spots with a victory on Saturday and a loss by the Detroit Tigers. That would be a tidier outcome than a slew of other possibilities.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  If Toronto pulls even with the Orioles at the end of the regular season, the Blue Jays will host the wild-card game on Tuesday because they won the teams\xe2\x80\x99 season series. But if Detroit is just a half-game ahead or behind after Sunday, the Tigers will have to make up a rained-out game against Cleveland on Monday. That could set up a three-way tie for two spots.Other possible outcomes are in play, too. The Seattle Mariners are still alive, and the Tigers, conceivably, could play five games in five cities from Sunday through Thursday. It is a lot to process. Privacy Policy     \xe2\x80\x9cWe could be playing Monday, we could be playing Tuesday, we could be playing Wednesday \xe2\x80\x94 and we could not be playing at all,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles Manager Buck Showalter said Friday afternoon, as rain washed out batting practice. \xe2\x80\x9cThe focus is trying to win these nine innings tonight, believe me. There\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of different things that will cloud your mind if you let them.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles are striving for another shot at their first championship since 1983. They lead the A.L. in victories and home runs \xe2\x80\x94 while committing the fewest errors \xe2\x80\x94 since the start of the 2012 season. But they have not advanced past the A.L. Championship Series. The Kansas City Royals swept them in that round two years ago.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIf you get in the tournament, who knows, right?\xe2\x80\x9d Duquette said. \xe2\x80\x9cSome of the teams that get into the tournament as a wild card, they do pretty well. Just got to win a couple more games and get into the tournament and take our chances.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles have gotten this far with extremes: They lead the majors in home runs, and have stolen the fewest bases. They have by far the most home runs, with 250, but have just 19 stolen bases and six triples, which would be the fewest ever by a team in a season.Yet the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 power and bullpen \xe2\x80\x94 anchored by the incomparable Zach Britton \xe2\x80\x94 have been enough to overcome the lack of speed, and a rotation with a 4.74 E.R.A. Every team with a higher starters\xe2\x80\x99 E.R.A. has a losing record. The Orioles have found a way, but this was not part of some master plan.\xe2\x80\x9cWe just try to get the best players we can get,\xe2\x80\x9d Duquette said. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes the value\xe2\x80\x99s in the relief pitchers. Sometimes it\xe2\x80\x99s in the power hitters. We\xe2\x80\x99ve tried to develop some good starters, which we\xe2\x80\x99re making progress on. So we\xe2\x80\x99re just trying to get the best players we can for the value, that\xe2\x80\x99s all.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 reliance on power, without power arms in their rotation, could be a dubious formula for October success. Mark Trumbo, the major league leader in home runs, sounded almost apologetic Friday when asked about the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 three-homer fifth inning, which included his 47th of the season.\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s kind of what we\xe2\x80\x99ve proven we do,\xe2\x80\x9d Trumbo said. \xe2\x80\x9cEspecially going into the situation we\xe2\x80\x99re in, I like the execution just as much, though. From here on out, beyond the regular season, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to see pitching that\xe2\x80\x99s going to be top of the line, and it\xe2\x80\x99s important against guys of that caliber to be able to scrap together some runs.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As soon as Saturday, the Orioles could clinch their opportunity. Showalter likes what he sees.\xe2\x80\x9cOur guys, they\xe2\x80\x99re going to be able to have a real peace about the endgame here, because they\xe2\x80\x99ve given themselves every chance,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t say this about every team I\xe2\x80\x99ve had, but this team will be as good as it\xe2\x80\x99s capable of being \xe2\x80\x94 I feel like, anyway. They\xe2\x80\x99re a real trustworthy bunch.\xe2\x80\x9d  A version of this article appears in print on October 1, 2016, on Page D1 of the New York edition with the headline: Orioles  Set Off, Destination Unknown. MAY 1       See More \xc2\xbb       ', 'www.nytimes.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: Starting Pitching Carries Toward ...', 'One could argue that the Baltimore Orioles were the best pitching staff in baseball in the month of September.The Baltimore Orioles played 27 games in the month of September, going 16-11. And, while many think of the Orioles as an offensive team, in September it was the pitching that carried the team.How good was the pitching?In the month, the team ERA was 2.90. That was the BEST in baseball. The starters had an ERA of 3.83, sixth-best in the American League. The relievers had an ERA under 1.50, best in the American League.More from Baltimore Orioles5/12 - Baltimore Orioles vs. Kansas City Royals: 4 things to watch5/11 - Baltimore Orioles sign first baseman/outfielder Adam Walker5/11 - Baltimore Orioles: Late-inning bullpen options in Minor Leagues5/11 - Baltimore Orioles: Could Logan Verrett be a starter?5/9 - Baltimore Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 Zach Britton to miss 45-60 days with forearm injuryThe BAA was .223, the second-best in the American League, and fourth-best in baseball.Another important stat is that the Baltimore Orioles had the lowest slugging percentage in all of Major League Baseball for the month. For a team that struggled with home runs allowed through the middle months, this was huge for the Baltimore Orioles.While we are digging into pitching stats, another interesting stat is that Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 pitchers threw the most pitches per plate appearance in baseball.The team, as mentioned earlier, won 16 games in the month. Starting pitchers won 12 of those, led by Ubaldo Jimenez and Dylan Bundy each winning three starts. Kevin Gausman and Yovani Gallardo both picked up two wins, with Wade Miley and Chris Tillman each winning once.Of the games won by relievers, one was an extra inning game with Oliver Drake getting the win, Brad Brach won two games (giving him ten wins on the year), and Brian Duensing picked up the huge win on Wednesday night against Toronto.More from The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles vs. Kansas City Royals: 4 things to watch8h agoBaltimore Orioles sign first baseman/outfielder Adam Walker1 d agoBaltimore Orioles: Late-inning bullpen options in Minor Leagues1 d agoBaltimore Orioles: Could Logan Verrett be a starter?1 d agoNBA playoffs: Wizards vs. Celtics Game 5: Live stream, odds and more2d agoEven though Miley and Tillman each only had one win, over the past week both had tremendous starts. Miley went 8 2/3 innings in a commanding performance against the Diamondbacks.Tillman was the starter in the game that Duensing ended up winning.Everyone knows of Ubaldo\xe2\x80\x99s contribution at this point, and Bundy did well despite not having the deepest of starts.Since being swept by the Red Sox, the opposition has scored 2, 1, 1, 5, 2, 0, and 1 runs. That is an average of less than a run per game. That\xe2\x80\x99s not bad.While we are talking about keeping the opposition off the board, know that the Baltimore Orioles have the fourth-best fielding percentage in the game, and the fourth-fewest errors. The fielding percentage is just .001 worse than the three top teams, Detroit, Houston, and Boston.Next: Ravens: 5 Matchups to Watch vs. Oakland Raiders  So, while many people want to count the Orioles and their all-or-nothing offense out come playoff time if current form holds, the team is pitching very well also.That just might help the Orioles surprise many in the American League. ', 'thebaltimorewire.com')]

[('Orioles beat Yankees, to face Blue Jays in AL wild card game', "The Orioles celebrate after beating the Yankees at Yankee Stadium.(Photo: Danny Wild, USA TODAY Sports)CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMOREThe Baltimore Orioles clinched their third playoff spot in five years, beating the New York Yankees 5-2\xc2\xa0on Sunday behind a pair of two-run homers from Matt Wieters and a strong outing from Kevin Gausman.The Orioles advance to Tuesday's wild card game against the Blue Jays at Toronto's Rogers Centre. Manager Buck Showalter did not announce who will start that game, though right-handers Chris Tillman and Ubaldo Jimenez are the likeliest candidates.Baltimore won the inaugural AL wild card game in 2012, and advanced to the American League Championship Series in 2014. Since they lost Saturday, the Orioles had to burn their best starter, Gausman, to ensure advancement Sunday.     .oembed-asset-link { background: #fff; border-bottom: 1px solid #e1e1e1; }     .oembed-link-anchor { display: block; clear: both; }     .oembed-link-thumbnail{ float: left; padding: 14px; }     .oembed-link-thumbnail img { max-width: 78px; max-height: 60px; display: block; }     p.oembed-link-title { font-size: 75%; color: #009BFF; margin: 0 14px; padding-top: 12px; font-weight:normal; text-align: left; line-height: 120%;  }     p.oembed-link-desc { font-size: 100%; color: #666; font-weight: normal; margin: 0 14px 14px 14px; font-family: 'Futura Today Light'; text-align: left; line-height: 120%; } USA TODAYBlue Jays clinch final MLB playoff berthGausman was up to the task. He pitched 7 1/3 innings, giving up eight hits before handing a 5-1 lead\xc2\xa0to All-Star closer Zach Britton. Britton gave up an RBI single to Didi Gregorius, but recorded the final five outs for his 48th save.The Orioles won 17 of their final 29 games to emerge from the wild card pack, ceding the AL East to the Boston Red Sox, but holding off the Tigers, Seattle Mariners and others.     .oembed-asset-photo-image { width: 100%; } GALLERY: MLB teams celebrate postseason berthsFacebookTwitterGoogle+LinkedInMLB teams celebrate postseason berths\xc2\xa0FullscreenPost to FacebookPosted!A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.                     });                 });             }          } })();  As soon as the Red Sox took a 3-0 lead in the top of the eighth inning Wednesday night, Lou Cucuzza Jr., the longtime manager of the visiting clubhouse at Yankee Stadium, put in the call to stadium operations. It was a go.Within seconds, a crew of maintenance workers descended on the visiting clubhouse with rolls of plastic wrap, tape and staple guns, feverishly erecting a protective wrapper around the roughly 900-square-foot room.But out on the field, the Yankees began a wild comeback in the bottom of the ninth inning, which Cucuzza watched carefully. If the Yankees won \xe2\x80\x94 as they did \xe2\x80\x94 and if the Baltimore Orioles lost to the Toronto Blue Jays, the Red Sox would not clinch the American League East title. Cucuzza and the maintenance crew would have had to tear down the work they had just completed in only a few minutes, before the losing players returned to the clubhouse.\xe2\x80\x9cI had my phone, and I was also watching the score in Toronto,\xe2\x80\x9d Cucuzza said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was close, but when I saw the Orioles scored in the ninth, I just said to leave it all up.\xe2\x80\x9d Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      When the Orioles won on Wednesday, the Red Sox clinched the division and were able to celebrate. Now it could be the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 turn, leaving Cucuzza and his crew to arrange and clean up a second celebration.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles, who lost to the Yankees, 7-3, on Saturday, could clinch a wild-card berth on Sunday, which would result in Yankee Stadium having hosted two Champagne-and-beer celebrations in less than a week, neither involving the Yankees themselves. Times have certainly changed.\xe2\x80\x9cIf you win, you\xe2\x80\x99ve earned that right,\xe2\x80\x9d Joe Girardi, the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 manager, said with a shrug. \xe2\x80\x9cIf you don\xe2\x80\x99t want them to celebrate, then don\xe2\x80\x99t let them beat you.\xe2\x80\x9dClubhouse celebrations have been a tradition in baseball dating at least to the 1950s. But with the advent of divisional play, and then of three divisions and two wild-card teams in recent years, the Champagne-infused fiestas have mushroomed.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  There are now five playoff teams in each league, so 10 teams can celebrate their entrance into the postseason. With each round of the playoffs (two wild-card games, two division series, two league championships and one World Series) factored in, baseball can have a total of 17 \xe2\x80\x9cChampagne fights,\xe2\x80\x9d as Japanese reporters like to call them. Privacy Policy     The unsung heroes of all these celebrations are the clubhouse attendants, like Cucuzza, who are charged with preparing for and cleaning up long after the last drop of Champagne has been poured over the last man on the roster.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cWe finished cleaning up around 3:30 in the morning,\xe2\x80\x9d Cucuzza said of Wednesday night\xe2\x80\x99s celebrations, \xe2\x80\x9cand that\xe2\x80\x99s faster than it used to be. But the kids did a tremendous job. The Red Sox players came in the next day and said they couldn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it did not even smell.\xe2\x80\x9dThat was in part because of a celebration innovation that could become as common as protective eyewear. Like a sharp baseball scout, Cucuzza was watching the Chicago Cubs celebrate their division championship on television last month when he noticed plastic wrapping on the floor of the Cubs\xe2\x80\x99 clubhouse, not just over the lockers.\xe2\x80\x9cI thought, \xe2\x80\x98There\xe2\x80\x99s an idea,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d Cucuzza said.So he and his staff did the same thing for the Red Sox\xe2\x80\x99 celebration Wednesday. When the party was over, Cucuzza and five members of his clubhouse staff gathered around sections of the plastic and lifted up the corners, creating a kiddie pool of the remnants of Champagne and beer. They carried it into a hamper and out to be drained. The process was repeated for the remaining sections of floor covering.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  When they were done, a cleaning crew shampooed the rug. In years past, when all the Champagne and beer spilled directly onto the carpet, the cleaning crew would have to come in two or three times to extract the liquid and shampoo the rug, and the smell would linger for days.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Red Sox celebrated their division title on Wednesday despite having lost on a game-ending grand slam by Mark Teixeira. If the Orioles had lost to the Blue Jays, Cucuzza and his staff would have quickly removed the carts full of Champagne and beer, as well as all that plastic. There would not have been time, however, to put all the furniture back in place.\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a tradition,\xe2\x80\x9d Red Sox Manager John Farrell said the day after the party. \xe2\x80\x9cLast night was surreal. It was odd. Do you celebrate after a loss? That\xe2\x80\x99s kind of a fundamental question.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles knew on Saturday that they could face similar circumstances on Sunday. If the Tigers lose on Sunday, and the Seattle Mariners were also to lose one of their last two games, then the Orioles could clinch even if they lose to the Yankees on Sunday.Buck Showalter, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 manager, has refused even to discuss any advance scouting for the playoffs, let alone the idea of celebrating after a loss.\xe2\x80\x9cWe are trying to do something that makes us that team,\xe2\x80\x9d he said before Saturday\xe2\x80\x99s loss.But if the Orioles do end up partying at Yankee Stadium on Sunday, Cucuzza and his staff will be there to clean it up. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek)(Photo: The Associated Press)CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORESo much for any Game No. 162 chaos in baseball: The San Francisco Giants, Toronto Blue Jays and Baltimore Orioles grabbed the last three playoff spots Sunday, and the October matchups are set.Neat and clean, no need for all sorts of tiebreakers. Too bad \xe2\x80\x94 that kind of final-day scramble might\'ve been fun for fans.Instead, they could sit back, savor Vin Scully\'s farewell call and prepare for the postseason. It opens Tuesday night when the Orioles visit Toronto in the AL wild-card game."All we asked for is an opportunity, and right now, we have an opportunity," Baltimore center fielder Adam Jones said after a 5-2 win over the New York Yankees. "So, let\'s celebrate and enjoy this and get back to work."No official word yet on the starting pitchers at Rogers Centre. Figures to be Chris Tillman for the O\'s against Marcus Stroman.On Wednesday night, aces duel as Madison Bumgarner starts for the Giants vs. Noah Syndergaard and the New York Mets at Citi Field in the NL wild-card game."We found a way to get back to where we need to be," Bumgarner said after his team\'s 7-1 win finished off a sweep of the Dodgers. "If we play like we have been the last three days, we\'ll be tough to beat."On Thursday, the best-of-five AL Division Series begins: David Ortiz and Boston at Cleveland, and the wild-card winner at Texas."I guess I wish Ortiz would consider retiring early," said Indians manager Terry Francona, who previously guided Big Papi with the Red Sox, "but I don\'t see that happening."On Friday night, Clayton Kershaw starts Game 1 for the Los Angeles Dodgers at Washington, and the NL wild-card winner plays the best-in-the-majors Chicago Cubs at Wrigley Field.Going into Game 162, Detroit and St. Louis also had a chance to reach the postseason. That raised the possibility of multi-team, multi-city tiebreakers going into early next week.The Tigers were in the middle of that mix. They hoped to win at Atlanta and have either the Orioles or Blue Jays lose \xe2\x80\x94 then, they would\'ve needed to win a makeup game at home Monday against Cleveland to force a tiebreaker for an AL wild-card spot."I would not have enjoyed the travel," Tigers manager Brad Ausmus said, "but I would have relished traveling."That kind of drama never developed as the teams holding leads took care of business.Manager Buck Showalter and Baltimore sealed their spot, winning at Yankee Stadium. When the Tigers later lost 1-0 at Atlanta in the last game at Turner Field, they were out and Toronto was back in for the second straight year.Later, the Blue Jays\' 2-1 victory at Fenway Park meant they would host Baltimore.With All-Star catcher Buster Posey getting three hits and driving in three runs, San Francisco beat the Dodgers and eliminated the Cardinals.The Giants have enjoyed a recent run of even-year success, winning the World Series in 2010, 2012 and 2014.The last time they reached the postseason, Bumgarner pitched a shutout at Pittsburgh in the wild-card game and went on to become the World Series MVP. So another cross-country flight to begin the playoffs was fine by them."I don\'t think it bothers anybody that we go on the road to win these games. It\'s actually a lot of fun," first baseman Brandon Belt said. "With Bumgarner on the mound, we\'re going to have a good shot."___This story has been corrected to delete a reference to the Giants playing at Dodger Stadium \xe2\x80\x94 the game was in San Francisco \xe2\x80\x94 and to correct that the Tigers would\'ve faced the Indians on Monday in a makeup game to force a tiebreaker for an AL wild-card spot.CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORECopyright 2016 The Associated Press.
